verses.text: ' And the general having heard this and many other things from him, was amazed and said, 'Of a truth this man is the servant of God.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 85:8
verses.text: For, unless he were beloved of God, whence could an ignorant man have such great understanding?'.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 86:2
verses.text: And a certain general, Balacius by name, persecuted us Christians bitterly on account of his regard for the Arians—that name of ill-omen.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 86:3
verses.text: And as his ruthlessness was so great that he beat virgins, and stripped and scourged monks, Antony at this time wrote a letter as follows, and sent it to him.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 86:4
verses.text: 'I see wrath coming upon thee, wherefore cease to persecute the Christians, lest haply wrath catch hold of thee, for even now it is on the point of coming upon thee.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 86:5
verses.text: ' But Balacius laughed and threw the letter on the ground, and spit on it, and insulted the bearers, bidding them tell this to Antony: 'Since thou takest thought for the monks, soon I will come after thee also.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 86:6
verses.text: ' And five days had not passed before wrath came upon him.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 86:7
verses.text: For Balacius and Nestorius, the Prefect of Egypt, went forth to the first halting-place from Alexandria, which is called Chaereu, and both were on horseback, and the horses belonged to Balacius, and were the quietest of all his stable.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 86:8
verses.text: But they had not gone far towards the place when the horses began to frisk with one another as they are wont to do; and suddenly the quieter, on which Nestorius sat, with a bite dismounted Balacius, and attacked him, and tore his thigh so badly with its teeth that he was borne straight back to the city, and in three days died.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 86:9
verses.text: And all wondered because what Antony had foretold had been so speedily fulfilled.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 87:2
verses.text: Thus, therefore, he warned the cruel.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 87:3
verses.text: But the rest who came to him he so instructed that they straightway forgot their lawsuits, and felicitated those who were in retirement from the world.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 87:4
verses.text: And he championed those who were wronged in such a way that you would imagine that he, and not the others, was the sufferer.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 87:5
verses.text: Further, he was able to be of such use to all, that many soldiers and men who had great possessions laid aside the burdens of life, and became monks for the rest of their days.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 87:6
verses.text: And it was as if a physician had been given by God to Egypt.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 87:7
verses.text: For who in grief met Antony and did not return rejoicing? Who came mourning for his dead and did not forthwith put off his sorrow? Who came in anger and was not converted to friendship? What poor and low-spirited man met him who, hearing him and looking upon him, did not despise wealth and console himself in his poverty? What monk, having being neglectful, came to him and became not all the stronger? What young man having come to the mountain and seen Antony, did not forthwith deny himself pleasure and love temperance? Who when tempted by a demon, came to him and did not find rest? And who came troubled with doubts and did not get quietness of mind?.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 88:2
verses.text: For this was the wonderful thing in Antony's discipline, that, as I said before, having the gift of discerning spirits, he recognised their movements, and was not ignorant whither any one of them turned his energy and made his attack.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 88:3
verses.text: And not only was he not deceived by them himself, but cheering those who were troubled with doubts, he taught them how to defeat their plans, telling them of the weakness and craft of those who possessed them.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 88:4
verses.text: Thus each one, as though prepared by him for battle, came down from the mountain, braving the designs of the devil and his demons.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 88:5
verses.text: How many maidens who had suitors, having but seen Antony from afar, remained maidens for Christ's sake.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 88:6
verses.text: And people came also from foreign parts to him, and like all others, having got some benefit, returned, as though set forward by a father.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 88:7
verses.text: And certainly when he died, all as having been bereft of a father, consoled themselves solely by their remembrances of him, preserving at the same time his counsel and advice.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 89:2
verses.text: It is worth while that I should relate, and that you, as you wish it, should hear what his death was like.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 89:3
verses.text: For this end of his is worthy of imitation.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 89:4
verses.text: According to his custom he visited the monks in the outer mountain, and having learned from Providence that his own end was at hand, he said to the brethren, 'This is my last visit to you which I shall make.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 89:5
verses.text: And I shall be surprised if we see each other again in this life.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 89:6
verses.text: At length the time of my departure is at hand, for I am near a hundred and five years old.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 89:7
verses.text: ' And when they heard it they wept, and embraced, and kissed the old man.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 89:8
verses.text: But he, as though sailing from a foreign city to his own, spoke joyously, and exhorted them 'Not to grow idle in their labours, nor to become faint in their training, but to live as though dying daily.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 89:9
verses.text: And as he had said before, zealously to guard the soul from foul thoughts, eagerly to imitate the Saints, and to have nought to do with the Meletian schismatics, for you know their wicked and profane character.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 89:10
verses.text: Nor have any fellowship with the Arians, for their impiety is clear to all.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 89:11
verses.text: Nor be disturbed if you see the judges protect them, for it shall cease, and their pomp is mortal and of short duration.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 89:12
verses.text: Wherefore keep yourselves all the more untainted by them, and observe the traditions of the fathers, and chiefly the holy faith in our Lord Jesus Christ, which you have learned from the Scripture, and of which you have often been put in mind by me.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 90:2
verses.text: But when the brethren were urging him to abide with them and there to die, he suffered it not for many other reasons, as he showed by keeping silence, and especially for this:—The Egyptians are wont to honour with funeral rites, and to wrap in linen cloths at death the bodies of good men, and especially of the holy martyrs; and not to bury them underground, but to place them on couches, and to keep them in their houses, thinking in this to honour the departed.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 90:3
verses.text: And Antony often urged the bishops to give commandment to the people on this matter.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 90:4
verses.text: In like manner he taught the laity and reproved the women, saying, 'that this thing was neither lawful nor holy at all.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 90:5
verses.text: For the bodies of the patriarchs and prophets are until now preserved in tombs, and the very body of the Lord was laid in a tomb, and a stone was laid upon it, and hid it until He rose on the third day.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 90:6
verses.text: ' And thus saying, he showed that he who did not bury the bodies of the dead after death transgressed the law, even though they were sacred.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 90:7
verses.text: For what is greater or more sacred than the body of the Lord? Many therefore having heard, henceforth buried the dead underground, and gave thanks to the Lord that they had been taught rightly.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:2
verses.text: But he, knowing the custom, and fearing that his body would be treated this way, hastened, and having bidden farewell to the monks in the outer mountain entered the inner mountain, where he was accustomed to abide.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:3
verses.text: And after a few months he fell sick.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:4
verses.text: Having summoned those who were there—they were two in number who had remained in the mountain fifteen years, practising the discipline and attending on Antony on account of his age—he said to them, 'I, as it is written, go the way of the fathers, for I perceive that I am called by the Lord.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:5
verses.text: And do you be watchful and destroy not your long discipline, but as though now making a beginning, zealously preserve your determination.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:6
verses.text: For ye know the treachery of the demons, how fierce they are, but how little power they have.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:7
verses.text: Wherefore fear them not, but rather ever breathe Christ, and trust Him.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:8
verses.text: Live as though dying daily.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:9
verses.text: Give heed to yourselves, and remember the admonition you have heard from me.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:10
verses.text: Have no fellowship with the schismatics, nor any dealings at all with the heretical Arians.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:11
verses.text: For you know how I shunned them on account of their hostility to Christ, and the strange doctrines of their heresy.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:12
verses.text: Therefore be the more earnest always to be followers first of God and then of the Saints; that after death they also may receive you as well-known friends into the eternal habitations.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:13
verses.text: Ponder over these things and think of them, and if you have any care for me and are mindful of me as of a father, suffer no one to take my body into Egypt, lest haply they place me in the houses, for to avoid this I entered into the mountain and came here.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:14
verses.text: Moreover you know how I always put to rebuke those who had this custom, and exhorted them to cease from it.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:15
verses.text: Bury my body, therefore, and hide it underground yourselves, and let my words be observed by you that no one may know the place but you alone.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:16
verses.text: For at the resurrection of the dead I shall receive it incorruptible from the Saviour.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:17
verses.text: And divide my garments.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:18
verses.text: To Athanasius the bishop give one sheepskin and the garment whereon I am laid, which he himself gave me new, but which with me has grown old.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:19
verses.text: To Serapion the bishop give the other sheepskin, and keep the hair garment yourselves.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 91:20
verses.text: For the rest fare ye well, my children, for Antony is departing, and is with you no more.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 92:2
verses.text: Having said this, when they had kissed him, he lifted up his feet, and as though he saw friends coming to him and was glad because of them—for as he lay his countenance appeared joyful—he died and was gathered to the fathers.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 92:3
verses.text: And they afterward, according to his commandment, wrapped him up and buried him, hiding his body underground.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 92:4
verses.text: And no one knows to this day where it was buried, save those two only.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 92:5
verses.text: But each of those who received the sheepskin of the blessed Antony and the garment worn by him guards it as a precious treasure.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 92:6
verses.text: For even to look on them is as it were to behold Antony; and he who is clothed in them seems with joy to bear his admonitions.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 93:2
verses.text: This is the end of Antony's life in the body and the above was the beginning of the discipline.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 93:3
verses.text: Even if this account is small compared with his merit, still from this reflect how great Antony, the man of God, was.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 93:4
verses.text: Who from his youth to so great an age preserved a uniform zeal for the discipline, and neither through old age was subdued by the desire of costly food, nor through the infirmity of his body changed the fashion of his clothing, nor washed even his feet with water, and yet remained entirely free from harm.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 93:5
verses.text: For his eyes were undimmed and quite sound and he saw clearly; of his teeth he had not lost one, but they had become worn to the gums through the great age of the old man.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 93:6
verses.text: He remained strong both in hands and feet; and while all men were using various foods, and washings and divers garments, he appeared more cheerful and of greater strength.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 93:7
verses.text: And the fact that his fame has been blazoned everywhere; that all regard him with wonder, and that those who have never seen him long for him, is clear proof of his virtue and God's love of his soul.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 93:8
verses.text: For not from writings, nor from worldly wisdom, nor through any art, was Antony renowned, but solely from his piety towards God.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 93:9
verses.text: That this was the gift of God no one will deny.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 93:10
verses.text: For from whence into Spain and into Gaul, how into Rome and Africa, was the man heard of who abode hidden in a mountain, unless it was God who maketh His own known everywhere, who also promised this to Antony at the beginning? For even if they work secretly, even if they wish to remain in obscurity, yet the Lord shows them as lamps to lighten all, that those who hear may thus know that the precepts of God are able to make men prosper and thus be zealous in the path of virtue.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 94:2
verses.text: Read these words, therefore, to the rest of the brethren that they may learn what the life of monks ought to be; and may believe that our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ glorifies those who glorify Him: and leads those who serve Him unto the end, not only to the kingdom of heaven, but here also—even though they hide themselves and are desirous of withdrawing from the world—makes them illustrious and well known everywhere on account of their virtue and the help they render others.

verses.name: Athanasius: Life of Antony 94:3
verses.text: And if need be, read this among the heathen, that even in this way they may learn that our Lord Jesus Christ is not only God and the Son of God, but also that the Christians who truly serve Him and religiously believe on Him, prove, not only that the demons, whom the Greeks themselves think to be gods, are no gods, but also tread them under foot and put them to flight, as deceivers and corrupters of mankind, through Jesus Christ our Lord, to whom be glory for ever and ever, Amen.
